intro: Talipariti glabrum, commonly known as the smooth talipariti, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Talipariti glabrum is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
